channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Senators grill Waymo and Tesla over robotaxi safety, liability, and China
item.description: During a two-hour hearing in the US Senate Wednesday, top executives from Waymo and Tesla urged lawmakers to take action on long-stalled legislation to speed the deployment of self-driving cars on public roads. But after two hours of Q&A around a number of hot-button topics, including robotaxi safety, legal liability, remote operation, and China, it […]...

item.title: The Wayback Machine debuts a new plugin designed to fix the internet’s broken links problem
item.description: WordPress is helping the non-profit fight the scourge of "link rot."

item.title: Zohran Mamdani Responds to Polymarket’s Free Grocery Store Stunt
item.description: Polymarket and Kalshi try to appeal to New Yorkers as regulatory scrutiny intensifies.

item.title: You Won’t Believe What’s Stuck in This Deer’s Antlers—and It’s a 2026 People’s Choice Finalist
item.description: It's time for the People's Choice Wildlife Photography Award, in which the public can vote on nature's most stunning—and disturbing—shots of the year.

item.title: Somehow, I’d Never Heard of This Post-Apocalyptic Football Movie
item.description: 'The Blood of Heroes' was released in 1989 and stars Rutger Hauer, Delroy Lindo, and Vincent D'Onofrio.

item.title: How to turn off the dreaded ‘soap opera’ effect on your TV
item.description: Your TV may be causing the soap opera effect, where movies look 'unreal': these are the settings you need to adjust or turn off.

item.title: This RTX 5070-powered Asus ROG Strix G16 is the mid-range gaming laptop I'd recommend to avoid extreme RAM and storage prices
item.description: Go big without going broke

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX company town is getting a police department
item.description: The new department will have up to eight police officers and could be up and running in a few months.

item.title: Meet Gizmo: a TikTok for interactive, vibe-coded mini apps
item.description: Gizmo's app is like a TikTok for vibe-coded mini apps...and it's a lot of fun.

item.title: AI SRE Resolve AI confirms $125M raise, unicorn valuation
item.description: The two-year-old startup confirms that it closed a Series A led by Lightspeed at $1 billion valuation.

item.title: Google parent Alphabet predicts a sharp surge in 2026 capital spending on AI
item.description: Revenue at Google Cloud grew 48% to $17.7 billion in the fourth quarter ended December, beating analyst’s expectations. Alphabet said on Wednesday it was targeting capital expenditure of $175 billion to $185 billion this year, in yet another aggressive ramp-up in spending from the Google parent as it deepens its investments to push ahead in the AI race....

item.title: Nintendo’s new Virtual Boy is more fun to look at than to play
item.description: Though the Virtual Boy was both a commercial and critical failure, the console's infamy is part of what has made it such a fascinating piece of Nintendo's history. Original units are still going for hundreds of dollars on bidding sites, and hobbyists have spent years keeping the Virtual Boy alive through emulation and homebrew games. […]

item.title: Gigantic Headphone Speakers Are the Goofiest Thing I’ve Ever Seen
item.description: JLab's Blue XL are making my brain hurt.

item.title: Amazon to begin testing AI tools for film and TV production next month
item.description: Amazon MGM Studios will reportedly begin a closed beta program in March to test its AI tools to help with film and TV production.

item.title: Even McDonald's thinks you need to change your passwords - especially if they're burger-related
item.description: McDonald warns common passwords like 'bigmac' and 'happymeal' remain highly vulnerable, urging stronger, randomized credentials for all users.

item.title: Measles Is Causing Brain Swelling in Children in South Carolina
item.description: In the ongoing measles outbreak in South Carolina that has infected more than 800 people, some children have developed a rare but serious complication called encephalitis.

item.title: Pizza Hut will close 250 ‘underperforming’ locations in 2026 as list of struggling restaurants grows
item.description: Parent company Yum! Brands said in its Q4 2025 earnings report Wednesday that it would shutter 3% of the pizza chain’s U.S. locations. Pizza Hut is closing hundreds of “underperforming” locations nationwide, according to parent company Yum! Brands, which reported fourth-quarter 2025 earnings on Wednesday.

item.title: Will an Nvidia Laptop Even Matter?
item.description: Who is going to save Nvidia’s first CPU from Nvidia?

item.title: Bipartisan SCAM Act would require online platforms to crack down on fraudulent ads
item.description: Without meaningful deterrents, Big Tech companies will do what's profitable, regardless of the cost to consumers. But a new bipartisan bill could add a check that would make them think twice, at least in one area. On Wednesday, Senators Ruben Gallego (D-AZ) and Bernie Moreno (R-OH) introduced legislation that would require social platforms to crack down on scam ads.The Safeguarding Consumers from Advertising Misconduct (SCAM) Act would require platforms to take reasonable steps to prevent fraudulent or deceptive ads that they profit from. If they don't, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and s...

item.title: Sam Altman responds to Anthropic’s ‘funny’ Super Bowl ads
item.description: Sam Altman responded to Anthropic's new Super Bowl ad in an X post on Wednesday, saying the OpenAI competitor's campaign is "clearly dishonest," and called it "on brand" for Anthropic to "doublespeak." "We would obviously never run ads in the way Anthropic depicts them," he wrote. "We are not stupid and we know our users […]

item.title: ‘Overwatch 2’ Rebrands, and Its Messy Arc Is Complete
item.description: Blizzard has become its own Infinity Gauntlet as it's tried to evolve and expand 'Overwatch' in interesting, often compromised ways.

item.title: Inside the Minneapolis restaurant that stopped charging for food until ICE leaves the city
item.description: Owner Dylan Alverson explains why Modern Times is now donation-only to feed hungry neighbors and stop contributing to taxes that fund ICE. February is always difficult in Minneapolis. It’s when the nerve-flaying cold of December and January starts to seem like a dress rehearsal. But this February has proven brutal for other reasons. As thousands of Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents storm the city with lethal force, many residents have larger troubles than the arctic weather. Some are terrified of getting detained or deported; others are worried about getting attacked for documenting ...

item.title: The Western US Is in a Snow Drought. What Comes Next Is Even Scarier
item.description: Major snowpack deficits could set the stage for widespread water scarcity and heightened wildfire risk across the American West this summer.

item.title: Why the Epstein Files Are Reviving a Conspiracy Theory About Wayfair and Human Trafficking
item.description: Sometimes a receipt for furniture is just a receipt for furniture.
